basic.description:
A historical survey taught in China, focusing on transformations of the built environment. Integrated site visits promote understanding of three major eras of change: radical reorganization under Mao, rapid expansion under the policies of Reform and Opening since 1978, and the recent shift toward Green development goals.
NOTE    Only offered in the Queen's-Blyth International Studies program. Instructor will accompany class to numerous off-campus sites and provide instruction during the outings; these activities will be integral to the course.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Contemporary China: From Red to Green
